item.title: Demonstrations continue at universities across the country during weekend commencement ceremonies
item.dc:creator: Minyvonne Burke and Joe Kottke and Suzanne Gamboa and Gary Grumbach and Rebecca Cohen
item.description: Demonstrations continued and new encampments were erected at universities across the country as commencement ceremonies took place Saturday following weeks of pro-Palestinian protests that have led to nearly 3,000 arrests, according to an NBC News tally.

media:content.media:text: Students celebrate their graduation.
media:content.media:description: Graduation commencement for the University of Southern California on May 10, 2024, in Los Angeles.

media:content.media:text: Palestinian insignia in a graduate.
media:content.media:description: A graduate at the University of Southern California wears a stole that says “Palestine” at commencement ceremonies Friday.

item.title: Israel orders new evacuations as it prepares to expand Rafah operations
item.dc:creator: Richard Engel and Alexander Smith
item.description: The Israeli military issued an “urgent warning” to evacuate parts of Rafah, signaling an expansion of its military campaign in Gaza's southernmost city.

media:content.media:text: Palestinians transport their belongings on the back of a van as they flee Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip to a safer location on May 11, 2023, amid the ongoing conflict between Israel and the militant group Hamas. Israeli strikes hit Gaza on May 11 after renewed US criticism over its conduct of the war and a UN warning of "epic" disaster if an outright invasion of crowded Rafah city occurs.
media:content.media:description: Palestinians transport their belongings on the back of a van as they flee Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip to a safer location on May 11, 2023, amid the ongoing conflict between Israel and the militant group Hamas. Israeli strikes hit Gaza on May 11 after renewed US criticism over its conduct of the war and a UN warning of "epic" disaster if an outright invasion of crowded Rafah city occurs.

media:content.media:text: Image:
media:content.media:description: Palestinians displaced by the Israeli air and ground offensive on the Gaza Strip arrive at a makeshift tent camp west of Rafah on Friday.

media:content.media:text: Smoke rises above buildings during an early morning Israeli strike on Rafah Saturday.
media:content.media:description: Smoke rises above buildings during an early morning Israeli strike on Rafah Saturday.

item.title: VP contender Doug Burgum joins Trump at campaign rally in New Jersey
item.dc:creator: Megan Lebowitz and Jake Traylor and Isabelle Schmeler
item.description: The North Dakota governor and former Republican presidential candidate praised Trump during remarks at Saturday's rally in Wildwood, New Jersey.

media:content.media:description: North Dakota Gov. Doug Burgum speaks during a campaign rally for Donald Trump in in Wildwood, N.J., on Saturday.

item.title: Northern lights visible across U.S., even reaching the deep south, due to solar storm
item.description: Dazzling colors lit up the night sky over the United States as the aurora borealis was visible as far south as Florida and even possibly Hawaii. NBC News’ George Solis speaks with a planetarium director to learn more about what’s causing the spectacle in the sky.

media:content.media:title: Northern lights visible across U.S., even reaching the deep south, due to solar storm
media:content.media:description: Dazzling colors lit up the night sky over the United States as the aurora borealis was visible as far south as Florida and even possibly Hawaii. NBC News’ George Solis speaks with a planetarium director to learn more about what’s causing the spectacle in the sky.

item.title: Switzerland’s Nemo becomes Eurovision's first nonbinary winner
item.description: Malmö, Sweden, plays host this year, as performers from 25 countries take the stage for the final.

media:content.media:text: Nemo from Switzerland celebrates with the trophy for winning Eurovision
media:content.media:description: Nemo from Switzerland celebrates with the trophy for winning the final of the Eurovision Song Contest in the Malmö Arena in Sweden on May 12, 2024.

item.title: A crown in chaos: How Miss USA’s resignation scandal rocked the pageant industry
item.dc:creator: Doha Madani and Kat Tenbarge
item.description: The sudden resignations of Miss USA and Miss Teen USA have triggered a fresh wave of scrutiny into the pageants’ owner, the Miss Universe Organization, as it continues to navigate what some close to the pageants see as an uncertain future.

media:content.media:text: Black and white photo of UmaSofia Srivastava and Noelia Voigt with a light pink overlay.
media:content.media:description: Miss Teen USA 2023, UmaSofia Srivastava, and Miss USA 2023, Noelia Voigt.

item.title: 'Baby Heaven: The Buried Stories of Camp Lejeune'
item.description: Baby Heaven: The Buried Stories of Camp Lejeune, for the first time five mothers detail their heart-break: veteran marines, wives and daughters most of whom are sick themselves, all of whom lost babies after being exposed to the toxic water at Camp Lejeune. Their journeys are filled with pain and fury as they confront the ways they say they’ve been lied to and deceived for decades. We hear from scientists, whistle-blowers and insiders including the General called by Congress to testify about o

media:content.media:title: 'Baby Heaven: The Buried Stories of Camp Lejeune'
media:content.media:description: Baby Heaven: The Buried Stories of Camp Lejeune, for the first time five mothers detail their heart-break: veteran marines, wives and daughters most of whom are sick themselves, all of whom lost babies after being exposed to the toxic water at Camp Lejeune. Their journeys are filled with pain and fury as they confront the ways they say they’ve been lied to and deceived for decades. We hear from scientists, whistle-blowers and insiders including the General called by Congress to testify about one of the biggest contaminations and cover-ups in U.S. history. A chemist who told the brass at Camp Lejeune in 1982 the water was contaminated with cancer-causing dry cleaning fluid but said they seemed “indifferent” ; a civilian water system operator who says he was told to send toxic water to people’s homes after senior staff insisted on watering the base golf course; the General who says he and the Commandant were lied to by the command at Camp Lejeune, while acknowledging no one was ever punished. And finally, we visit a section of a Jacksonville, North Carolina cemetery called “Baby Heaven” as these mothers search for their children and the truth.

item.title: Oprah Winfrey apologizes for her ‘major’ role in ‘diet culture’: ‘I own what I’ve done’
item.dc:creator: Francesca Gariano, TODAY

item.title: Auroras expected to continue as forecast calls for geomagnetic storm activity into next week
item.dc:creator: Dennis Romero and Rebecca Cohen and The Associated Press
item.description: Auroras lighting up night skies across the United States are becoming a free, multi-day music festival for the eyes, likely to return Saturday and Sunday, and possibly into next week, federal forecasters said.

media:content.media:text: Northern lights in California
media:content.media:description: Northern lights illuminate the sky of San Francisco North Bay as seen from China Camp Beach in San Rafael, Calif., on May 11, 2024.

media:content.media:description: Northern lights appear in the night sky above the Brocken in Schierke, northern Germany on Saturday.

item.title: Mexico heat wave melts temperature records in 10 cities, including Mexico City
item.dc:creator: Reuters and Tangni Noriega
item.description: Ten cities in Mexico have registered record-high temperatures, including the capital, authorities said on Friday, amid a searing heat wave that has prompted blackouts nationwide and pushed the power grid to the brink.

media:content.media:text: People protect themselves from the sun.
media:content.media:description: People protect themselves from the sun during a heat wave hitting the country in Guadalajara, Mexico, on May 9, 2024.

media:content.media:text: A man carries a jerrycan of water.

item.title: Justice Alito warns of declining support for freedom of speech on college campuses
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Hurley
item.description: Conservative Supreme Court Justice Samuel Alito on Saturday warned that support for freedom of speech is "declining dangerously," especially on college campuses, as part of a commencement address he delivered at the Franciscan University of Steubenville, a Catholic college in Ohio.

media:content.media:text: Supreme Court Justice Samuel Alito.
media:content.media:description: Justice Samuel Alito, who is Catholic, has frequently raised the alarm about freedom of religion being under attack and has often voted in favor of expanding religious rights.

item.dc:creator: Erik Ortiz

item.title: Hundreds killed by flash floods in northern Afghanistan, U.N. says
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Flash floods from unusually heavy seasonal rains in Afghanistan have killed more than 300 people and destroyed over 1,000 houses, the U.N. food agency said.

media:content.media:text: Afghan men clear debris and mud from a damaged house following a flash flood after a heavy rainfall in Laqiha village of Baghlan-i-Markazi district in Baghlan province on May 11, 2024. At least 62 people, mainly women and children, were killed on May 10 in flash flooding that ripped through Afghanistan's Baghlan province, in the north of the country, a local official told AFP.
media:content.media:description: Men clear debris and mud from a damaged house following a flash flood after a heavy rainfall in the village of Laqiha on Saturday.

item.title: Netherlands’ Eurovision contestant kicked out of song contest over backstage incident hours before final
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: A Dutch broadcaster reacted angrily after the Netherlands’ contestant in Eurovision, Joost Klein, was expelled hours before the final over a backstage incident.
